generic_title: What will you learn at the Multimedia Design and Communication program?
generic_description: The objective of the program is to qualify graduates to independently design, plan, realise and manage multimedia tasks and to assist in the implementation, administration and maintenance of multimedia productions. The programme is an academy profession programme corresponding to 120 European Credit Transfer System (ECTS) points. It is a full-time programme equating to two student full-years
When you study Multimedia Design and Communication you will gain the following:
list_element1: - Knowledge  relevant to analysis, ideation, design, planning, realisation and management of multimedia tasks as well as the implementation, administration and maintenance of multimedia productions.
list_element2: - Gain understanding of interdisciplinary multimedia issues in relation to both individual and team-based project work.
list_element_2_1: - Methods and tools relevant to analysis, ideation, design and planning as well as the realisation and management of multimedia tasks
list_element_2_2: - Evaluate practice-oriented issues in the multimedia field and propose and select possible solutions
list_element_2_3: - Communicate practice-oriented issues and possible solutions in the multimedia field to partners and users
list_element_3_1: - Independently undertake analysis, ideation, design and planning as well as the realisation and management of multimedia tasks and participate in the implementation, administration and maintenance of multimedia productions
list_element_3_2: - Handle development-oriented situations and be innovative in the tailoring of multimedia solutions to commercial conditions
list_element_3_3: - Engage in management and cooperation with others regardless of educational, linguistic and cultural background
list_element_3_4: - Participate in and manage cooperation and communication in networks based on a professional approach.

generic_description: The focus of the program develops 4 main areas:
list_element1: Provides the necessary qualifications to understand the commercial framework of the business and digital business models, apply digital user data and take an innovative approach to multimedia production
list_element_2_1: This area will enable the students to understand digital media and create innovative digital user experiences. The students are capable of producing digital content and useroriented communication.
list_element_3_1: Is intended to enable the students to design and develop advanced digital user interfaces based on user-oriented design principles and incorporating international development trends within digital design.
